message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.HC, cs.MM, cs.IR. 

The paper proposes a framework for transfer learning in human activity recognition using sensor data from different body positions. This involves selecting the most similar source domain and performing accurate knowledge transfer. The paper involves machine learning (cs.LG) and computer vision (cs.CV) techniques for activity recognition. It also involves human-computer interaction (cs.HC) as the goal is to recognize activities of daily living. Multimedia (cs.MM) is relevant as the data involves sensor data from different body positions. Information retrieval (cs.IR) is also relevant as the paper discusses the potential applications of the proposed framework in other fields of pervasive computing.
